page.title: 14The Warmington Valley #2
page.content: Much of the valley is given over to pasture for sheep and cattle.There are some crops of rape seed and cereals with occassionally maize. Until recent years the valley has been very boggy with poor drainage and flooding at the first signs of rain. The small stream which meanders through it,is bordered by Willow trees. This has been the source of much joy to small boys trying out fishing for the first time and spending a many happy hour catching the sticklebacks and minnows. The farmers have recently been very active improving the land by investment in land drains to overcome the flooding and reclaim more ground for crops.The area is prosperous for farmers,this being acredited to the balance of high(dry) and low(wet) land always allowing crops and pasture.
